content:
I don't know how much use this will be to others, but I made a way to serialize Lean.Syntax as JSON and get it out the compiler. I'm using it for ML.

https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/compare/master...Ocean-Moist:lean4:master

Wasn't that hard. I also am not familiar with lean very much at all, much less the lean compiler, I kind of just changed things until it worked. If someone wanted, they could make this an actual cli flag and make it legitimate, but this more or less works for me.
Rohan Ganapavarapu has marked this topic as resolved.
Your link is misformatted so it isn't clickable, and even the text leads to an empty diff!
